abstract: Anthony Tommasini reviews program With You, Armenia: A Concert to Commemorate the Centennial of the Armenian Genocide, sponsored by Yerevan Perspectives International Music Festival and featuring pianist Evgeny Kissin, at Carnegie Hall.
lead_paragraph: The pianist and Armenia’s Hover State Chamber Choir performed at Carnegie Hall in a remembrance of the century-old Armenian genocide in the waning days of the Ottoman Empire.

headline.main: Review: In ‘With You, Armenia,’ Kissin and Others Honor the Slaughtered
headline.print_headline: Honoring the Slaughtered With Melting Harmonies

snippet: The pianist and Armenia’s Hover State Chamber Choir performed at Carnegie Hall in a remembrance of the century-old Armenian genocide in the waning days of the Ottoman Empire.

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
keywords.name: subject
